input_sentence: if ego vehicle is turning left and there is no relevent traffic light for the ego and other vehicle is going to turn right or going straight and other vehicle is onto the oncoming lane of ego then in this case ego shall yield to other vehicle.

atomic_propositions.description: No relevant traffic light for ego
Other vehicle is on the oncoming lane of ego

temporal_relations.description: If ego is turning left with no relevant traffic light, and other is turning right or going straight on ego's oncoming lane, then ego must yield

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_traffic_light → traffic_light

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: turning_left(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_3: turning_right(other) [unary predicate]
   - ap_4: going_straight(other) [unary predicate]
   - ap_5: on_oncoming_lane_of(other,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_6: yield_to(ego,other) [binary predicate with related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: turning_left(ego) & ~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) & (turning_right(other) | going_straight(other)) & on_oncoming_lane_of(other,ego)
   - Consequent: yield_to(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G ((turning_left(ego) & ~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) & (turning_right(other) | going_straight(other)) & on_oncoming_lane_of(other,ego)) -> yield_to(ego,other))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_traffic_light → traffic_light

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: turning_left(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_3: turning_right(other) [unary predicate]
   - ap_4: going_straight(other) [unary predicate]
   - ap_5: on_oncoming_lane_of(other,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_6: yield_to(ego,other) [binary predicate with related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: turning_left(ego) & ~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) & (turning_right(other) | going_straight(other)) & on_oncoming_lane_of(other,ego)
   - Consequent: yield_to(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, indicating "Always" or "Globally" that the condition must hold.
- The antecedent (left side of the implication) contains multiple predicates connected by logical operators:
  - `turning_left(ego)` translates to "the ego vehicle is turning left"
  - `~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego)` with negation becomes "the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle"
  - `(turning_right(other) | going_straight(other))` becomes "the other vehicle is turning right or going straight"
  - `on_oncoming_lane_of(other,ego)` translates to "the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane of the ego vehicle"
- These are all combined with `&` (and) to form the complete condition
- The consequent (right side of the implication) is `yield_to(ego,other)` which translates to "the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle"
- The implication `->` connects these as "if [condition] then [consequence]"

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is turning left and the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle and the other vehicle is turning right or going straight and the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is turning left and the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle and the other vehicle is turning right or going straight and the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, indicating "Always" or "Globally" that the condition must hold.
- The antecedent (left side of the implication) contains multiple predicates connected by logical operators:
  - `turning_left(ego)` translates to "the ego vehicle is turning left"
  - `~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego)` with negation becomes "the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle"
  - `(turning_right(other) | going_straight(other))` becomes "the other vehicle is turning right or going straight"
  - `on_oncoming_lane_of(other,ego)` translates to "the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane of the ego vehicle"
- These are all combined with `&` (and) to form the complete condition
- The consequent (right side of the implication) is `yield_to(ego,other)` which translates to "the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle"
- The implication `->` connects these as "if [condition] then [consequence]"

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
